CatDescriptText: image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1969, page 1 reads: "BCC Leaders and Marchers - The city's "Black Monday" demonstration march in behalf of the Black Construction Coalition's drive to gain construction jobs for blacks was led by BCC leaders and included an estimated 10,000 persons....A portion of the marchers [in the right photo shows them] parading down Fifth Ave. Before moving back to the Hill District, the huge throng completely surrounded the new USS building at 7th Ave. & Grant St."
TitMainTitle: Black Construction Coalition's "Black Monday" demonstration march down Fifth Avenue in front of Warner Theater, Beck's Shoes, and McCrory's, Downtown
